summary: My Hero {2/?}
body:
My Hero {2/?}

|Request: Anything with a reader that had been abused would be good to my feels, if you’re okay with it❤️ ~ Anonymous|

|Ship: Bucky X Reader|

|Warnings: Abuse, Language|

|Angst, Fluff|

Y/N woke up in an unfamiliar room. Her head throbbed as she looked around. It looked to be a hospital room. She went to hold her head but a sharp pain in her arm stopped her from doing so.

She looked down and saw a needle in her arm. Her eyes went wide as one word popped into her head. Injections.

She ripped the needle out and got up quickly. She was dressed in a hospital gown and had a bandage wrapped around her head. She tried to open the single door in the room but it was locked.

“Oh God, please no.” Y/N could only think of what the Hydra agents were planning for her.

She heard footsteps and backed into the corner of the room. She cowered and lowered her head as a dark skinned, one eyed man walked in.

“I’m sorry! Please! I’ll do better next time! I’ll kill them as ordered! Please I won’t do it again!” Y/N screamed as tears ran down her face.

The man looked confused and then worried. “I promise you I am not here to hurt you. I am not Hydra.” he said.

“Wh-who are you then?” she asked, voice barely above a whisper.

“I’m director Fury. I see you don’t like needles.” he said gesturing to her bleeding arm and missing IV.

She nodded wearily. “Why aren’t I dead?”

“Stark had no intentions of killing you. He just needed to knock you out. You did suffer a massive blow though, which has caused a minor concussion. Other than that you’re physically healthy.” Fury said.

“You’re with the Avengers? Are you here to take me to jail?” Y/N asked.

“That is if you don’t accept my offer. You easily hacked into the security system and took out the guards. You successfully broke Agent Romanoff’s nose and one of Agents Barnes ribs. I’d like you to become an Avenger.”

Y/N shook her head. “No way, I am not joining some sissy hero clique.”

“Either join our sissy clique or rot in a cell for the rest of your life. It’ll take half a year before we let you out of the tower alone if you accept the offer. You can handle that though.” He crossed his arms.

“Fine but I’m not playing nice.” she whispered.

“Great let’s get you a Shield jumpsuit.” He said motioning her to follow.

They walked down a hallway and he grabbed a suit off a hangar throwing at her.

“Get changed in there and also,” he put a bracelet on her wrist, “this is to make sure you don’t leave.”

Y/N turned and walked into the small room to change. The jumpsuit looked exactly like the one Agent Romanoff tends to where, and Y/N felt self conscious in it.

“Do they all show this much cleavage?” she mumbled.

She walked back out and Fury led her to Conference room.

“I’ll call the Avengers.” he said said picking up the phone.

“No winter soldier. I don’t want to see him.” she said looking away.

Fury nodded and held the phone to his ear. “Come to the conference room without Barnes. Don’t give me shit Stark hurry up.”

Steve, Tony, Natasha, and Clint walked in the room. Natasha had a bandage on her nose and she sent a glare at Y/N.

“What is she doing here?” she asked sourly.

“Meet the new Avenger.”

A/N: Hope you enjoyed❤

blog.name: oreostars
blog.title: ms. writer
blog.description: masterlist + fandoms + prompt list + rules + tag list + wattpad + ms.writer 🐶 puerto rican & cuban 🐶 she-her 🐶 hufflepuff 🐶 multi-fandom author 🐶 requests:OPEN

tags: in con sol a ble window
summary: in·con·sol·a·ble window
title: in·con·sol·a·ble window
body:
Marvel

Tony Stark x platonic! gender - neutral reader

Warnings: mentions of death, depression, panic attacks, nightmares

Specifics: angst, sadness, crying, death, based on avengers: infinity war, gender neutral reader, platonic relationship, race neutral reader

People: Tony Stark, you, Peter Parker (mentioned), Pepper Potts (mentioned)

Words: 1,300

Requested: By @impetrichorny Hi. can you do a fic where Tony is talking to someone and just screams about having Peter die in his arms? i just want an angsty screaming Tony dealing with Peter’s death. xoxo


Authors Note: yes i know the title is a definition title but i thought it looked aesthetically cool lookin idk but yeah this is a sad one folks, BUT one of my favs that i have written!!!! so thank u so much for requesting cuz i luv luv luv for some reason luv writing angst! but this does talk about peters death and about iw and the sad crap that happened in this movie. i used an art gif by the amazing @silverink58 their art is amazing so pls check them out. i luv to hear ur guys feedback and advice on how to improve my writing so dont be afraid to talk to me and enjoy guys. HERE TAKE SOME TISSUES CUZ UR GONNA NEED EM!

Life was strenuous. It was unfair and heart breaking. You try your best, you give it your all, and in the end the monsters that were hidden come out and win.

Why do all the bad guys win?

Life without the others was hard. It was empty and dull, and there was no comfort found. So many civilians depended on the Avengers, the Earth’s mightiest heroes. Some depended on anyone who could save the day. 

But…the conclusion…the heroes, aliens, supernatural powers, even gods could not stop the terror of Thanos. 

You sat by the large window of your home, peering at all the corners, now noticing really how large that window truly was. 

“Why did I need such a big window, no in fact why did I need such a big house when all I ever wanted was right in front of me?”

You thought to yourself, sipping silently and thoughtfully at your warm cup of (fav hot drink). The weather outside was gray but the sun still shone through the clouds, peeking ever so slightly. It was also very windy. So windy it seemed as if the trees were dancing. 

You brought your hands together in a tight clasp. Noticing all the scars and bruises from that fight with Thanos. Oh how you thought, “you all would win.” How you thought that, “maybe life might find a way?” 

But there was no other solution. 

You were having your dear friend Tony Stark over to keep him company. Peter Parker. The sweet, sweet boy. The smile on his face brightened up the room and made everyone happy, now he was gone, forever. 

You wanted to keep Tony company but you had to ask yourself, “was it also you, though, that needed some human interaction as well? Maybe even more?”

Just as you were pondering over the thinking of how woebegone you are, the doorbell rang. 

You walked to the door and opened it revealing a miserable Tony. 

“Hey Tony,” you softly said, giving Stark a reassuring hug.

“Yeah, hi y/n, hows everything?”

You nodded, ushering him inside the warm, gigantic house, “Its more or less the same.” You sighed and went to the kitchen while Tony sat by the big window. The kitchen was connected as one big area to where Tony was at. 

“Can I get you something to drink,” you asked fiddling with your fingers. 

Tony, looking out the window, answered, “coffee please.”

You set to work on brewing the coffee. You sat back down, in front of Tony, once you were done and the machine had to do the rest. 

“So Tony, how are you doing?”

Tony’s attention was back to you and you noticed this was not the same man. He had more wrinkles on his face and he had deep, dark, bags under his eyes. His face was more pale, also. You knew he was not getting a lot of rest. 

“Well with what? All those that died, their deaths? Fine, I mean I don’t sleep, don’t eat as much, have more panic attacks and nightmares then ever before. Have to take more medication, yeah my life’s great.”

You bit your lip and felt bad for asking him that question, “I’m sorry Tony, I didn’t mean-”

Tony dug his face into his hands and erupted a huge sigh, “No y/n, I’m sorry. I know you just worry about me.”

“I do, hows Pepper taking it?”

“One day at a time. Same as me, and same as Happy. God do you know how terrible this feels?”

You looked down at your hands, not wanting to meet his eyes. You knew what he was trying to say. “No, Tony, I probably don’t. I was close to the kid, but not as close as you were to him.”

You got up and went to check on the coffee, seeing that it was done you poured the liquid into a pale brown cup, handing it to Tony. 

Tony quietly thanked you and took some pills out of his pocket. He popped them in his mouth, then took a gulp of the caffeine. 

“What are those for,” you pointed to the pile of different colored drugs that were lying in Tony’s palm. 

“Depression, pain, you know, those types of things.”

“Tony, I want to help you. As your friend I want to help you cope through your loss.”

Tony tapped lightly on the table, “what about you? Have you gotten over the deaths?”

You shook your head, “You don’t get over, Tony, you proceed, you move forward. Those people were not just coworkers, they were our family. Peter, was family. Time is a terrible thing, but time aids you to keep going even though life may seem tough.”

“His face, that face he made when he,” his lips trembled and his hands turned into fists. “When he disappeared. I still see him y/n. Every time I close my eyes he’s there telling me he doesn’t want to go and y/n, sometimes I feel like I can’t do this anymore. I can’t keep pretending that everything’s alright when its not. I’m not alright.”

“Its gonna be that way for a while. You can’t think that way though, that you want to give up cause in the end you and me both know that’s not what Peter would of wanted. And don’t pretend, Tony if you need to cry, cry! If you need to scream, scream! I am here for you. Always, no matter what.”

“I should of protected him!”

His voice was like a thunder clap, it echoed and boomed through out the house. 

“I should have saved him, I should of been the one to have died not him! Not him! He was too young y/n, he was too good for this world. Me, I have done some bad things in my life, but Peter, god I haven’t said that name since that fateful day. But Peter, he was good, he was a light in this dark, twisted world,” Tony sniffled, trying not to shed a tear. “I made the mistake of taking him with me.”

You stood up and placed both your hands on the table. “Don’t! Don’t do that! Okay, this, his death, is not your fault. He knew what he was getting into and for that you should be proud of him. He risked his life Tony, for the world. At a young age some kids would of been selfish, but not Peter. He wanted to show you and the world that he would protect it with his life.”

“I know, I know, and that’s just what makes it worse. I wanted to tell him how proud I was of him. How much he meant to me.”

“I understand,” you patted Tony’s shoulder. Comfort and hope would be hard to feel. You opened your mouth wanting to say more but nothing came out. 

“Do you know,” Tony gulped his sobs but nothing could stop them. His tears came out with such force, “how painful it was to tell May, about her nephew? What was I supposed to say, hey Peter tried to save humanity but he didn’t, no, instead he turned into ashes. Y/n do you know how hard that was? I watched Peter die in my arms! I couldn’t tell him he was going to be okay, that he would see his aunt again, nothing, it was too late! I was too late.”

Tears formed in your e/c eyes. “The only thing I can do is be here for you. That’s what I will always do. Be here, by your side.”

You looked into Tony’s cup to see his cup was empty. You picked it up and made your way to the kitchen, brewing another pot for him to drink by the wide, lonely, sad window.
body_abstract:
Marvel

Tony Stark x platonic! gender - neutral reader

Warnings: mentions of death, depression, panic attacks, nightmares

Specifics: angst, sadness, crying, death, based on avengers: infinity war, gender neutral reader, platonic relationship, race neutral reader

People: Tony Stark, you, Peter Parker (mentioned), Pepper Potts (mentioned)

Words: 1,300

Requested: By @impetrichorny Hi. can you do a fic where Tony is talking to someone and just screams about having Peter die in his arms? i just want an angsty screaming Tony dealing with Peter’s death. xoxo


Authors Note: yes i know the title is a definition title but i thought it looked aesthetically cool lookin idk but yeah this is a sad one folks, BUT one of my favs that i have written!!!! so thank u so much for requesting cuz i luv luv luv for some reason luv writing angst! but this does talk about peters death and about iw and the sad crap that happened in this movie. i used an art gif by the amazing @silverink58 their art is amazing so pls check them out. i luv to hear ur guys feedback and advice on how to improve my writing so dont be afraid to talk to me and enjoy guys. HERE TAKE SOME TISSUES CUZ UR GONNA NEED EM!

Life was strenuous. It was unfair and heart breaking. You try your best, you give it your all, and in the end the monsters that were hidden come out and win.

Why do all the bad guys win?

Life without the others was hard. It was empty and dull, and there was no comfort found. So many civilians depended on the Avengers, the Earth’s mightiest heroes. Some depended on anyone who could save the day. 

But…the conclusion…the heroes, aliens, supernatural powers, even gods could not stop the terror of Thanos.

Life was strenuous. It was unfair and heart breaking. You try your best, you give it your all, and in the end the monsters that were hidden come out and win.

Why do all the bad guys win?

Life without the others was hard. It was empty and dull, and there was no comfort found. So many civilians depended on the Avengers, the Earth’s mightiest heroes. Some depended on anyone who could save the day. 

But…the conclusion…the heroes, aliens, supernatural powers, even gods could not stop the terror of Thanos. 

[[MORE]]

You sat by the large window of your home, peering at all the corners, now noticing really how large that window truly was. 

“Why did I need such a big window, no in fact why did I need such a big house when all I ever wanted was right in front of me?”

You thought to yourself, sipping silently and thoughtfully at your warm cup of (fav hot drink). The weather outside was gray but the sun still shone through the clouds, peeking ever so slightly. It was also very windy. So windy it seemed as if the trees were dancing. 

You brought your hands together in a tight clasp. Noticing all the scars and bruises from that fight with Thanos. Oh how you thought, “you all would win.” How you thought that, “maybe life might find a way?” 

But there was no other solution. 

You were having your dear friend Tony Stark over to keep him company. Peter Parker. The sweet, sweet boy. The smile on his face brightened up the room and made everyone happy, now he was gone, forever. 

You wanted to keep Tony company but you had to ask yourself, “was it also you, though, that needed some human interaction as well? Maybe even more?”

Just as you were pondering over the thinking of how woebegone you are, the doorbell rang. 

You walked to the door and opened it revealing a miserable Tony. 

“Hey Tony,” you softly said, giving Stark a reassuring hug.

“Yeah, hi y/n, hows everything?”

You nodded, ushering him inside the warm, gigantic house, “Its more or less the same.” You sighed and went to the kitchen while Tony sat by the big window. The kitchen was connected as one big area to where Tony was at. 

“Can I get you something to drink,” you asked fiddling with your fingers. 

Tony, looking out the window, answered, “coffee please.”

You set to work on brewing the coffee. You sat back down, in front of Tony, once you were done and the machine had to do the rest. 

“So Tony, how are you doing?”

Tony’s attention was back to you and you noticed this was not the same man. He had more wrinkles on his face and he had deep, dark, bags under his eyes. His face was more pale, also. You knew he was not getting a lot of rest. 

“Well with what? All those that died, their deaths? Fine, I mean I don’t sleep, don’t eat as much, have more panic attacks and nightmares then ever before. Have to take more medication, yeah my life’s great.”

You bit your lip and felt bad for asking him that question, “I’m sorry Tony, I didn’t mean-”

Tony dug his face into his hands and erupted a huge sigh, “No y/n, I’m sorry. I know you just worry about me.”

“I do, hows Pepper taking it?”

“One day at a time. Same as me, and same as Happy. God do you know how terrible this feels?”

You looked down at your hands, not wanting to meet his eyes. You knew what he was trying to say. “No, Tony, I probably don’t. I was close to the kid, but not as close as you were to him.”

You got up and went to check on the coffee, seeing that it was done you poured the liquid into a pale brown cup, handing it to Tony. 

Tony quietly thanked you and took some pills out of his pocket. He popped them in his mouth, then took a gulp of the caffeine. 

“What are those for,” you pointed to the pile of different colored drugs that were lying in Tony’s palm. 

“Depression, pain, you know, those types of things.”

“Tony, I want to help you. As your friend I want to help you cope through your loss.”

Tony tapped lightly on the table, “what about you? Have you gotten over the deaths?”

You shook your head, “You don’t get over, Tony, you proceed, you move forward. Those people were not just coworkers, they were our family. Peter, was family. Time is a terrible thing, but time aids you to keep going even though life may seem tough.”

“His face, that face he made when he,” his lips trembled and his hands turned into fists. “When he disappeared. I still see him y/n. Every time I close my eyes he’s there telling me he doesn’t want to go and y/n, sometimes I feel like I can’t do this anymore. I can’t keep pretending that everything’s alright when its not. I’m not alright.”

“Its gonna be that way for a while. You can’t think that way though, that you want to give up cause in the end you and me both know that’s not what Peter would of wanted. And don’t pretend, Tony if you need to cry, cry! If you need to scream, scream! I am here for you. Always, no matter what.”

“I should of protected him!”

His voice was like a thunder clap, it echoed and boomed through out the house. 

“I should have saved him, I should of been the one to have died not him! Not him! He was too young y/n, he was too good for this world. Me, I have done some bad things in my life, but Peter, god I haven’t said that name since that fateful day. But Peter, he was good, he was a light in this dark, twisted world,” Tony sniffled, trying not to shed a tear. “I made the mistake of taking him with me.”

You stood up and placed both your hands on the table. “Don’t! Don’t do that! Okay, this, his death, is not your fault. He knew what he was getting into and for that you should be proud of him. He risked his life Tony, for the world. At a young age some kids would of been selfish, but not Peter. He wanted to show you and the world that he would protect it with his life.”

“I know, I know, and that’s just what makes it worse. I wanted to tell him how proud I was of him. How much he meant to me.”

“I understand,” you patted Tony’s shoulder. Comfort and hope would be hard to feel. You opened your mouth wanting to say more but nothing came out. 

“Do you know,” Tony gulped his sobs but nothing could stop them. His tears came out with such force, “how painful it was to tell May, about her nephew? What was I supposed to say, hey Peter tried to save humanity but he didn’t, no, instead he turned into ashes. Y/n do you know how hard that was? I watched Peter die in my arms! I couldn’t tell him he was going to be okay, that he would see his aunt again, nothing, it was too late! I was too late.”

Tears formed in your e/c eyes. “The only thing I can do is be here for you. That’s what I will always do. Be here, by your side.”

You looked into Tony’s cup to see his cup was empty. You picked it up and made your way to the kitchen, brewing another pot for him to drink by the wide, lonely, sad window.

“I understand,” you patted Tony’s shoulder. Comfort and hope would be hard to feel. You opened your mouth wanting to say more but nothing came out. 

“Do you know,” Tony gulped his sobs but nothing could stop them. His tears came out with such force, “how painful it was to tell May, about her nephew? What was I supposed to say, hey Peter tried to save humanity but he didn’t, no, instead he turned into ashes. Y/n do you know how hard that was? I watched Peter die in my arms! I couldn’t tell him he was going to be okay, that he would see his aunt again, nothing, it was too late! I was too late.”

Tears formed in your e/c eyes. “The only thing I can do is be here for you. That’s what I will always do. Be here, by your side.”

You looked into Tony’s cup to see his cup was empty. You picked it up and made your way to the kitchen, brewing another pot for him to drink by the wide, lonely, sad window.
trail.content_abstract:
Marvel

Tony Stark x platonic! gender - neutral reader

Warnings: mentions of death, depression, panic attacks, nightmares

Specifics: angst, sadness, crying, death, based on avengers: infinity war, gender neutral reader, platonic relationship, race neutral reader

People: Tony Stark, you, Peter Parker (mentioned), Pepper Potts (mentioned)

Words: 1,300

Requested: By @impetrichorny Hi. can you do a fic where Tony is talking to someone and just screams about having Peter die in his arms? i just want an angsty screaming Tony dealing with Peter’s death. xoxo


Authors Note: yes i know the title is a definition title but i thought it looked aesthetically cool lookin idk but yeah this is a sad one folks, BUT one of my favs that i have written!!!! so thank u so much for requesting cuz i luv luv luv for some reason luv writing angst! but this does talk about peters death and about iw and the sad crap that happened in this movie. i used an art gif by the amazing @silverink58 their art is amazing so pls check them out. i luv to hear ur guys feedback and advice on how to improve my writing so dont be afraid to talk to me and enjoy guys. HERE TAKE SOME TISSUES CUZ UR GONNA NEED EM!

Life was strenuous. It was unfair and heart breaking. You try your best, you give it your all, and in the end the monsters that were hidden come out and win.

Why do all the bad guys win?

Life without the others was hard. It was empty and dull, and there was no comfort found. So many civilians depended on the Avengers, the Earth’s mightiest heroes. Some depended on anyone who could save the day. 

But…the conclusion…the heroes, aliens, supernatural powers, even gods could not stop the terror of Thanos.
